014package org.jdbi.v3.core.argument;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Collection;
018import java.util.Collections;
019import java.util.Optional;
020import java.util.function.Function;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.UnableToCreateStatementException;
024
025import static org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes.findGenericParameter;
026import static org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes.getErasedType;
027
028/**
029 * An {@link ArgumentFactory} base class for arguments of type {@code T}. For values of type {@code T}, factories
030 * produces arguments from the {@link #build(Object, ConfigRegistry)} method. For null values with a known expected type
031 * of {@code T}, produces null arguments for the {@code sqlType} passed to the constructor.
032 * <pre>
033 * class ValueType {
034 *     String value;
035 * }
036 *
037 * class ValueTypeArgumentFactory extends AbstractArgumentFactory&lt;ValueType&gt; {
038 *     ValueTypeArgumentFactory() {
039 *         super(Types.VARCHAR);
040 *     }
041 *
042 *     &#64;Override
043 *     protected Argument build(ValueType valueType, ConfigRegistry config) {
044 *         return (pos, stmt, ctx) -&gt; stmt.setString(pos, valueType.value);
045 *     }
046 * }
047 * </pre>
048 *
049 * Don't forget to override {@link Object#toString} in your {@link Argument} instances if you want to be able to log their values with an {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.SqlLogger}.
050 *
051 * @param <T> the type of argument supported by this factory.
052 */
053public abstract class AbstractArgumentFactory<T> implements ArgumentFactory.Preparable {
054    private final int sqlType;
055    private final ArgumentPredicate isInstance;
056    private final Type argumentType;
057
058    /**
059     * Constructs an {@link ArgumentFactory} for type {@code T}.
060     *
061     * @param sqlType the {@link java.sql.Types} constant to use when the argument value is {@code null}.
062     */
063    protected AbstractArgumentFactory(int sqlType) {
064        this.sqlType = sqlType;
065        argumentType = findGenericParameter(getClass(), AbstractArgumentFactory.class)
066                .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException(getClass().getSimpleName()
067                    + " must extend AbstractArgumentFactory with a concrete T parameter"));
068
069        if (argumentType instanceof Class) {
070            Class<?> argumentClass = (Class<?>) argumentType;
071            this.isInstance = (type, value) ->
072                    argumentClass.isAssignableFrom(getErasedType(type)) || argumentClass.isInstance(value);
073        } else {
074            this.isInstance = (type, value) -> argumentType.equals(type);
075        }
076    }
077
078    @Override
079    public Optional<Function<Object, Argument>> prepare(Type type, ConfigRegistry config) {
080        return isInstance.test(type, null)
081                ? Optional.of(value -> innerBuild(value, config)
082                        .orElseThrow(() -> new UnableToCreateStatementException("Prepared argument " + value + " of type " + type + " failed to bind")))
083                : Optional.empty();
084    }
085
086    @Override
087    public Collection<Type> prePreparedTypes() {
088        return Collections.singletonList(argumentType);
089    }
090
091    @Override
092    public final Optional<Argument> build(Type type, Object value, ConfigRegistry config) {
093        if (!isInstance.test(type, value)) {
094            return Optional.empty();
095        }
096        return innerBuild(value, config);
097    }
098
099    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
100    private Optional<Argument> innerBuild(Object value, ConfigRegistry config) {
101        return Optional.of(value == null
102                ? new NullArgument(sqlType)
103                : build((T) value, config));
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Produce an argument object for the given value.
108     *
109     * @param value  the value to convert to an argument
110     * @param config the config registry
111     * @return an {@link Argument} for the given {@code value}.
112     */
113    protected abstract Argument build(T value, ConfigRegistry config);
114
115    private interface ArgumentPredicate {
116        boolean test(Type type, Object value);
117    }
118}
